error.msg: Using memset() on struct which contains a floating point number.
error.verbose: Using memset() on struct which contains a floating point number. This is not portable because memset() sets each byte of a block of memory to a specific value and the actual representation of a floating-point value is implementation defined. Note: In case of an IEEE754-1985 compatible implementation setting all bits to zero results in the value 0.0.

error.msg: Technically the member function 'ImVector < unsigned short >::max_size' can be static (but you may consider moving to unnamed namespace).
error.verbose: The member function 'ImVector < unsigned short >::max_size' can be made a static function. Making a function static can bring a performance benefit since no 'this' instance is passed to the function. This change should not cause compiler errors but it does not necessarily make sense conceptually. Think about your design and the task of the function first - is it a function that must not access members of class instances? And maybe it is more appropriate to move this function to an unnamed namespace.

error.msg: Technically the member function 'C78E::GUI::ImGuiLayer::begin' can be static (but you may consider moving to unnamed namespace).
error.verbose: The member function 'C78E::GUI::ImGuiLayer::begin' can be made a static function. Making a function static can bring a performance benefit since no 'this' instance is passed to the function. This change should not cause compiler errors but it does not necessarily make sense conceptually. Think about your design and the task of the function first - is it a function that must not access members of class instances? And maybe it is more appropriate to move this function to an unnamed namespace.

error.msg: Using memset() on struct which contains a floating point number.
error.verbose: Using memset() on struct which contains a floating point number. This is not portable because memset() sets each byte of a block of memory to a specific value and the actual representation of a floating-point value is implementation defined. Note: In case of an IEEE754-1985 compatible implementation setting all bits to zero results in the value 0.0.

error.msg: C-style pointer casting
error.verbose: C-style pointer casting detected. C++ offers four different kinds of casts as replacements: static_cast, const_cast, dynamic_cast and reinterpret_cast. A C-style cast could evaluate to any of those automatically, thus it is considered safer if the programmer explicitly states which kind of cast is expected.

A C-style cast could evaluate to any of those automatically, thus it is considered safer if the programmer explicitly states which kind of cast is expected.

error.msg: Using memset() on struct which contains a floating point number.
error.verbose: Using memset() on struct which contains a floating point number. This is not portable because memset() sets each byte of a block of memory to a specific value and the actual representation of a floating-point value is implementation defined. Note: In case of an IEEE754-1985 compatible implementation setting all bits to zero results in the value 0.0.

This change should not cause compiler errors but it does not necessarily make sense conceptually. Think about your design and the task of the function first - is it a function that must not access members of class instances? And maybe it is more appropriate to move this function to an unnamed namespace.

And maybe it is more appropriate to move this function to an unnamed namespace.

error.msg: Using memset() on union which contains a floating point number.
error.verbose: Using memset() on union which contains a floating point number. This is not portable because memset() sets each byte of a block of memory to a specific value and the actual representation of a floating-point value is implementation defined. Note: In case of an IEEE754-1985 compatible implementation setting all bits to zero results in the value 0.0.

error.msg: Using memset() on union which contains a floating point number.
error.verbose: Using memset() on union which contains a floating point number. This is not portable because memset() sets each byte of a block of memory to a specific value and the actual representation of a floating-point value is implementation defined. Note: In case of an IEEE754-1985 compatible implementation setting all bits to zero results in the value 0.0.

error.msg: Technically the member function 'Applayer::onKeyPressed' can be static (but you may consider moving to unnamed namespace).
error.verbose: The member function 'Applayer::onKeyPressed' can be made a static function. Making a function static can bring a performance benefit since no 'this' instance is passed to the function. This change should not cause compiler errors but it does not necessarily make sense conceptually. Think about your design and the task of the function first - is it a function that must not access members of class instances? And maybe it is more appropriate to move this function to an unnamed namespace.
